course_title: Special Topics In Economics: Health Economics
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 11Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
class_notes: Instructor permission required to enroll. Synchronous class attendance required. Technology required: webcam, microphone. Econ 101 is a prerequisite.  In this class, we will apply economic principles and tools to study the healthcare market by looking at the structure, cost, and distribution of resources within the healthcare sector. Topics will include the socioeconomic determinants of health, demand and supply of health insurance, hospital competition, physician practice, government intervention in the health-care market, and comparisons of health-systems around the world.
course_description: Course may be repeated for credit when topic varies. Seminar and/or advanced course in selected topics in economics.
sections: Class Nbr: 4329, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 9:40-10:55a, Instructor: D. Ludwinski, Status: Open
